content: l a c i r t e m m y s a f r a c s this is really a recipe for a basic asymmetrical triangular scarf it can easily be modified with different stitch patterns i knit this with some fingering/dk weight handspun yarn but any yarn will work great way to use one skein of beautiful yarn use the size of knitting needles appropriate for your yarn gauge isn t important basic asymmetrical scarf cast on 5 stitches row 1 rs kfb work in pattern to last 2 stitches k2togb row 2 ws ktb work in pattern to the last stitch kfb work these two row for the desired length bind off on a wrong side row stitch pattern row 1 rs k abbreviations row 2 ws p k - knit row 3 k p - purl row 4 p ktb - knit through the row 5-9 k back row 10 p kfb - knit front and back row 11 k row 12 p single increase row 13+14 k k2togb - knit 2 together row 15 *yo k2tog* repeat through the back row 16 k yo - yarn over k2tog - knit 2 together repeat these 16 row for the length of the scarf rs - right side the pattern is basically small sections of stockinette garter ws - wrong side stockinette and garter lace the garter keeps the scarf from curling note - at the end of every second garter lace yo k2tog row there is an extra stitch you can either just knit it or knit to the last 3 stitches and slip one k2togb pass slip_stitch over this pattern is intended for personal non-commercial use only joanne thread head © 2015
